alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 02 at 6:00PM MST until September 02 at 8:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR AREAS ACROSS THE VERDE VALLEY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Areas near Clarkdale to Cottonwood to Camp Verde. * WHEN...Until 900 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Water flowing over roadways will create slick paved roads and muddy unpaved roads. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 559 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Dry Creek, Gap Creek, Gaddis Wash, Dry Beaver Creek, West Clear Creek, Verde River, Beaver Creek, Little Ash Creek, Oak Creek, Oak Wash, Chasm Creek, Bull Run Creek, Blowout Creek, Cherry Creek, Little Sycamore Creek, Coffee Creek, Bitter Creek, Grief Hill Wash, Spring Creek, Cienega Creek and Russell Wash. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Camp Verde, Clarkdale, Middle Verde, Montezuma Castle N.M., Aultman, Fort Verde State Historic Park, Montezuma Castle National Monument, McGuireville, Mcguireville, Hayfield Draw OHV Area, Beaverhead Flat, Jordan, Verde Valley Ryal Canyon Trailhead, Bignotti, Lake Montezuma, Verde Lakes, Cornville, Rocking River Ranch State Park, Tissaw Trailhead and Mormons Crossing Swimming Hole. - This includes the following swimming holes... Mormons Crossing and West Clear Creek near the campground. This includes the following highways... State Route 260 between mile markers 207 and 231. Interstate 17 between mile markers 283 and 294. State Route 89A between mile markers 350 and 365. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well.
